questions.question: 1. Which of the following configurations is commonly seen in the case of the amino acids that form human proteins?

answers.c: Can be either L or D
answers.d: Can be either R or S

questions.question: 2. Amino acids exist as ______ at neutral pH

answers.d: Charged, but net charge is zero

questions.question: 4. The titration curve of glycine represents ______.

answers.d: One buffering region at neutral pH

questions.question: 5. Which of the following amino acids exist as negatively charged ions at neutral pH?
6. Which of the following amino acids exist as positively charged ions at neutral pH?
7. Which of the following properties of a protein is least likely to be affected by changes in pH?
8. The dissociation constant of H2O at 25° C is ______.
9. The naming is commonly done in the following manner

answers.a: pKa1 – COOH, pKa2 – NH2, pKa3 – R group
answers.b: pKa1 – NH2, pKa2 – R group, pKa3 – COOH
answers.c: pKa1 – NH2, pKa2 – COOH, pKa3 – R group

questions.question: 10. Which of the following leads to the neutral charge of an amino acid?

answers.a: Deprotonation of COOH and protonation of NH2
answers.b: Deprotonation of NH3<sup>+</sup> and protonation of COO<sup>-</sup>
answers.c: Protonation of NH<sub>3</sub><sup>+<sup> and deprotonation of COO<sup>-</sup>
